title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
The first point is earned for successful demonstration of the quotient rule.

The second point is earned for a response that arrives at the given expression rather than an algebraically equivalent expression.

Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
The response is eligible for the third point if either of the first 2 points is earned and the answer with reason is consistent with the previous results.

Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
The first and second points require evidence of quotient rule and chain rule and no errors. At most 1 out of 3 points is earned for partial communication of quotient rule and chain rule with a maximum of one computational error.

A simplified answer is not required for the third point.

Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Supporting work is not required to earn the point.

Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include a correct position.
The student response accurately includes a correct position.
